review_text: i have stayed in many air bnbs, but zuhair's home is on a completely different level. it was the best place my husband and i have stayed in. the home is gorgeous, incredibly clean, welcoming, and cozy. we felt like we were on a houseboat and couldn't get over how great it was to experience such a cool home. the house sits off a busy road, but it's in a great location with close access to restaurants, downtown springfield, and bradley airport so we didn't mind. the surroundings are breathtaking and we enjoyed waking up to/sitting on the screened in porch listening to nature/watching the water. the home is equipped with everything you'd need: bluetooth speakers, games, extra blankets/towels, and even condiments! also, zuhair is friendly, knowledgable, and a pleasure to work with. he should teach a class on how to "air bnb" because he nailed it. new england is our second home and this will be our go to place. do yourself a favor and book this home. you will not regret it. thanks zuhair!

review_text: We feel so lucky to have found this riverside home, the most beautiful Airbnb we have experienced. It was the perfect size for our family, and absolutely tranquil - the screened in porch is the best place to watch the sunrise and sunset. We have never been welcomed with such an array of teas and coffees. The place was spotless, with every convenience having been considered - plenty of the softest blankets, lots of food containers for storing leftovers, a state of the art range and microwaveâ€¦. We were able to work from the Airbnb because of the flawless wifi. Zuhair checked in regularly, not too much or too little, and any time we had any needs (like more paper towels), he dropped them at the door within an hour. The waterfall shower was a comfort every day! I have only positive words about this luxurious place. We hope to come back again!

review_text: My partner and I were looking for a scenic spot to stay the night passing through the area and this place was perfect! The setting on the river was great and very chill. We were drawn to the home mainly because of the outdoor space but, due to the rain, didn't get to use it. That didn't matter a bit though as watching and listening to the rain fall into the lush trees and onto the river was super cozy and very relaxing after a long drive. Zuhair was exceptional in his communication and responsiveness, as well as his generosity in making sure we were comfortable and had everything we needed. Definitely a top notch host in a very nice setting. Only thing to be aware of is that you can hear some noise from the highway across the river but, after a while, it really just became white noise. Sleeping itself was very quiet and comfortable. Kitchen was well-appointed and ambiance inside the cottage was perfect for the setting and very clean. All in all, a fantastic stay! Thank you, Zuhair!

Every detail of this place was clearly carefully thought out to create a special experience. Zuhair clearly cares a lot about the place and about people enjoying it. He is very friendly and responsive. The river is gorgeous, with views of it from almost everywhere in the house. You can walk down and sit by it and kayak as well. The kitchen is stocked with everything you need, including Nespresso pods and machine. There are games and toiletries and just anything you could think of needing. We were so sad to leave and truly wish the place was our own. I can't remember feeling so relaxed.

review_text:
My family of 4 thoroughly enjoyed a relaxing weekend at Zuhair's lake house. It was tastefully renovated and of a quality like you'd find in someone's own home. Fun amenities included a motorized adjustable bed that my kids dubbed "the sandwich bed", Nespresso machine, a gas fire pit and even toothbrush kits in case you forgot yours. The house was tastefully decorated and comfortable to cook, eat, and lounge around in all day.
Zuhair was friendly, communicative and responsive from booking through check in, offering advice on traffic and local grocery stores. We got locked out once and he was able to remotely reset the door code in no time.
The outside deck area was great for BBQ and lounging. There's a great paved path that runs along the river which leads straight to the house, perfect for running or biking. Oh, and there are games - giant Jenga! We had a blast and would definitely stay again.

(Before we checked out, we CHECKED the brand of the mattress. We're ordering one this weekend!) REST: MISSION ACCOMPLISHED! Another reviewer mentioned road noise. In 4 days, we may have HEARD 4 cars? It was NOT an issue. If you plan to cook and are VERY tall, this might not be the house for you. The house is clean and bright, immaculate and old (which made me happy. We had fun trying to decide whether it was formerly a carriage house or a chicken coop, or something else.) There is one thing and I feel lame mentioning it. There are 2 TINY steps up to the master bedroom (3 inches high?) and I hate to mention it but when you have knees as bad as mine, those 2 steps first thing in the morning, we'll put it this way, I noticed them, my husband didn't. LOVED THE HOUSE, loved the town. Excellent coffee at Rices Fruit farm. Look forward to another visit!

Picture the cutest, most charming cottage, combined with the stylish, cozy charm of every tiny house youâ€™ve seen and you have Marcâ€™s place! We enjoyed two very cozy nights in late October. Upon check-in (which was smooth and simple) we were greeted with a fire in the fire pit, such a lovely touch for a beautiful fall evening. We ordered a delicious Pizza from about 5 min away and enjoyed it by the fire. The bed was very comfortable and each night we slept about 9 hours (weâ€™re both bad sleepers, so that was INCREDIBLE!). The kitchen is small but we made a delicious dinner our second night and had everything we needed. All of the decor and woodwork in the cottage is so peaceful and beautiful. The cottage is located behind Marcâ€™s house, but we felt like we had complete privacy. The rain shower was also fabulous after a rainy day zip lining at Berkshireâ€™s East (SO FUN!). The cottage warmed up super fast as well, but there were also fans in each room, which we really appreciated. We will without a doubt be back (the next time we need good sleep!). Thanks so much Marc!

review_text: If you're looking for a clean, warmly decorated place to stay in a great location that's quiet, this is the place for you. We couldn't be more pleased about our decision to stay at Donna's Airbnb. There are good restaurants nearby, including Sultan Family Restaurant where we ate the first night, just about a mile away. If you're planning to visit the museums in Springfield, please don't miss the Museum of Springfield History which is just a short walk from the Dr. Seuss, science and art museums. You'll be amazed at the number of famous people and inventions that have sprung from Springfield. We also visited the Basketball Hall of Fame which is nearby in Springfield and easy to get to with free parking on site.

Has a little kitchen with minifridge, toaster, microwave, Kurege Coffee Machine (with a selection of roasts), a basket of snacks and plates, bowls (for cereal?), mugs and glasses provided plus flatware. soft carpet, sofa and generous sized bed with very large flat screen tv with Netflix access plus good WiFi service. Helpful hints and notes throughout the place. Two caveats - Fnding the side unpaved drive/path down the hill at night to the back door, which is tricky. Although Donna was very quick in responding to all communications, they all go through the Airbnb app, which if you are not quick or comfortable doing with a mobile / smart phone, they can potentially lead to frustration, not the fault of the hostess. Very satisfied Airbnb travelers.

Charmaine was a great communicator, sending me all the information I needed when I needed it, which was perfect since I was extremely busy with work. I didn't have time to cook, but while I prepared my breakfast each morning I noticed that the kitchen was well-stocked with cooking utensils and appliances- as a tea drinker I really appreciated the nice kettle!

Just note that you'll need to walk outside through the grass to get to and from your car and the room - so if you're going out or wearing nice clothes/shoes you may want to keep that in mind. Also, be sure to bring slippers to wear inside to honor the host's "no shoes" request. Great stay, and Alyssa was so helpful. She brought down a steamer for me so I could get the "travel wrinkles" out of a dress shirt - immediate response, and very accommodating. Great host! And yes, we occasionally heard the sounds of playing above us, but it was not at all disturbing to us, and I wouldn't let that discourage anyone from staying here.

The weather was extremely hot and humid while I was there, but the air conditioner worked so well and was EXTREMELY quiet, so I was beyond comfortable. They have thought of everything, including everything you need to make meals, with a grocery store nearby. The neighborhood is safe and friendly with parking right out front. On the last day, I locked my keys in my trunk. They came out with tools and helped me, even after AAA said there was no way to get them. I stay in many Airbnb's, but this one is at the top of my list. I can't wait to visit again!

Parking just a few feet away from the door in a private lot was such a convenience, especially after a long day of exploring. It gave us peace of mind knowing our vehicle was safe and easily accessible.
The cleanliness of the bathroom was top-notch, and we were pleasantly surprised by the hot water with good pressure in the shower. It's those little details that truly make a difference in the overall comfort of a stay.

review_text: The space was as described in the listing. It does have low ceilings and a steep staircase without a railing. The bed was uncomfortableâ€¦too firm for my taste and sloped to the right. I never really heard voices or much sound, but I was awoken every night by someone walking above between 2 and 4 AM. I did not get a good nights sleep any of the days I stayed. The rugs and shower curtain smelled of mildew and needed to be washed. While the room is separate from the rest of the house, and I never felt like I would be intruded upon, there is no door or way to secure the basement apartment from the rest of the home. All in all, you get what you pay for, and the rate was very reasonable for what was provided.

The ad says mini kitchen and the pictures only show the fridge wall and table wall. The other wall has a small toaster oven â€“ no potholders. There was bottled water and creamer in the fridge. As other guests have said, the ceilings are a tad bit low, which might be a challenge if you donâ€™t know how to duck. I lived in a basement apartment, so Iâ€™m used to hearing a heat system kick on and upstairs tenant noise, so it wasnâ€™t too big of a deal for me. It's a great location if you're going to the Big E or something downtown around Memorial Bridge. I had a good stay. Thank you!

review_text: Nice little apartment, firm comfortable bed, quite private. Very Nice laundry machines (you pay a bit extra). While this place might be best for travelers with cars, from the point of view of someone who arrived with Lyft, the neighborhood really shuts down at night. One could order food for delivery (there are some brochures). However, in the morning there is a quite nice place about a five minute walk away called Memo's. Very local and relaxing, good light muffins (three berry is particularly good) and not awful coffee. Also I was able to walk over the bridge to the bus at MCM Casino, it was pleasant. Perhaps West Springfield has much more going on on weekdays. Also, the small historic area near Symphony Hall is worth a look, and on other trips, I have enjoyed the museums here.

review_text: Salomiâ€™s place is a Victorian beauty in a peaceful neighborhood with other well kept historical homes. We stayed for three nights over our sonâ€™s graduation weekend from a local college and appreciated it every step of the way. The house itself is stunning with original woodwork. There are 6 bedrooms to choose from, all unique, all with comfortable beds. The upstairs bathroom has a clawfoot tub which, though I never had a chance to use, is just beautiful. The Air BnB is equipped with every possible thing you could need and the full kitchen even offers a fridge stocked with water and juice, an adorable coffee bar, and snacks. Salomi has thought of everything. We were especially grateful because Salomi allowed us to have a gathering of family and friends at the house after the graduation ceremony. The back yard and deck were the perfect setting for a truly special time that we will remember forever. This house is a gem and Salomi is the ultimate host. I canâ€™t wait to go back!

Only issue we had was with some of the cleanliness and clutter, with some trash left behind in a few of the bedroom trash cans when we arrived and a few miscellaneous items in the bedroom closets and dressers.
